prs.title: Feature/faster deleteprefix
prs.truncated_body:
- every deletePrefix caches the given prefix in a map.
- Next deletePrefix on the SAME prefix will be a noop.
- Any write to the store's map will look cause a lookup to the cache, invalidating any prefix matched by that entry.

This addresses the scenario where a module will constantly try to delete stores that begin by the prefix of the "previous month" or similar.

commits.message: on tier2, delete existingExecOuts as we use them to free up memory

make 'deletePrefix' faster by keeping a cache of previously deleted prefixes

this improves the case where the module will try to delete all keys beginning by YYYYMM for monthly aggregations or similar stories
clarify reversibleBuffers early deletion in comments

commits.message:
contrib: fix quic compat tests

- Fixes broken builds due to API changes https://github.com/firedancer-io/firedancer/pull/4732
- Update Agave QUIC client to 2.2.7

types: fix test_types_fixtures

- Fixes excessive memory usage (13 GiB -> 3 MiB)
- Reverts spad allocator change to scratch allocator
- Support static declaration of fd_types_yaml
- Fix missing header guard in fd_types_yaml.h

types: reduce global bloat

Only produce position-independent type decoders when explicitly
requested.

Introduces a new 'global' attribute in 'types.json'.  If set on a
top-level struct, the attribute is propagated to all sub types.
chore: turn memcpys to assignments where possible
flameco/genesis_rent: Slot 0 always needs to be handled in the genesis case
flamenco, gossip: log when received no CRDS traffic (indicator for bad shred version)

Parallel quick sort

By popular demand, started to install high performance parallel sorting
algorithms.  This PR generalizes the existing dual pivot in-place quick
sort to be NUMA aware cache oblivious data adaptive thread parallel.
Like the other thread parallel unit tests, the parallel sort unit test
will use as many tiles are given to the test via the command line.

Additionally:

- Minor reorganization of the sort template to follow the layout used
  by more recent parallel algorithm templates.  No external impact from
  a user point of view but should make it easier to add additional
  parallel sorting algos in the near future.

- Drive by documentation cleanups and replicated documentation
  elimination the sort template.
codeql: allow uploading SARIF file to GH Code Scanning

flamenco/bench:
  initialize POH correctly
  enable the features we want on by default
  cleanup unused memory
flamenco: support saving and detecting downloaded snapshots
syscall, flamenco: restore total epoch stake from snapshot
flamenco, types: fix broken yaml walk for gossip ip4/6 addr type

Parallel merge sorts

By popular demand and mentioned in parallel quick sort PR, this PR adds
additional styles of parallel sorting.  This provides a thread parallel,
NUMA friendly, cache friendly merge sort implementation.  (As a
reminder, unlike quick sorts, merge sorts are stable but out-of-place.)

This implementation has an asymptotic wallclock of O(N) in the large
thread count limit (as opposed to the N log N for a serial merge sort).

test_sort_para was updated to large arrays with more heavily randomized
testing to explore more threading edge cases.

Tweaked FD_TPOOL_MAP_REDUCE to make this cleaner to implement and less
restrictive to use and updated the test_tpool to reflect this.
Specifically:

- FD_TPOOL_MAP_REDUCE no longer requires fd_scratch to be configured
  on the tpool threads used for the sorting.

- The reduce section makes the thread split and element split used in
  the previous stage of reduction available to the user.

Plan to add one more style of parallel sort (based on statistical
sampling with slightly better average asymptotics) in the near future.
flamenco, vm: check sbpf version when checking stack gapped accesses
vm: update permalink to tagged version
firedancer-dev: add backtest (shred source: rocksdb) command
Adjust config comments for full Firedancer

prs.title: Properly handle auto-restored entries in e2e_invoke.
prs.truncated_body:
### What

Properly handle auto-restored entries in e2e_invoke.

There are two requirements for auto-restored entries:
- If entry is not removed, it must be extended by at least min persistent TTL (notably, this should be reflected in the host function effects)
- The entry is considered to have not existed for the purpose of rent (i.e. it's initial size and live_until_ledger are 0)

Both re

commits.message:
Properly handle auto-restored entries in e2e_invoke.

There are two requirements for auto-restored entries:
- If entry is not removed, it must be extended by at least min persistent TTL (notably, this should be reflected in the host function effects)
- The entry is considered to have not existed for the purpose of rent (i.e. it's initial size and live_until_ledger are 0)

Both requirements can be easily fulfilled in get_ledger_changes, given that we have the restored_entry_ids passed from the transaction.

Also added a couple tests that cover that.

prs.title: state machine updates for tx replay
prs.truncated_body:
- Closes https://github.com/stacks-network/stacks-core/issues/5968

This PR implements:

- Detecting forks in the signer state machine

commits.message:
[tmpnet] Separate start of prometheus and promtail collectors

Previously local collectors were always started together. For kube,
though, it makes sense to support only starting prometheus (e.g. to
collect metrics from a the load generation framework) since logs and
metrics for nodes will be collected by agents within the kube cluster.
fixup: Ensure both methods of starting collectors are equivalent
fixup: Strictly separate start and stop

prs.title: Cache null values on findStorage calls (0.129)
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

Cherry pick of #11155 to `release/0.129`.

If many requests for the same non-existent value happen in a short burst, caching null avoids overwhelming the DB during that time and in the mean time any potential change in the DB will be picked up very soon since the cache entry TTL is 1 second.

**Related issue(s)**:

**Notes for reviewer**:

**Checklist**

- [x] Documen

prs.title: fix(ethexe): switch to blocking RwLock in MockBlobReader
feat!(gear): invariant for value passing only with messages; error replies inherit value as well
prs.truncated_body:
Previously, on error occurred, error reply had value=0 and initially applied one was immediately silently returned on the balance of the source. Now it's attached to err reply and unlocks once err reply handled.

UPD:
Short summary:
1. Value is always transferred on message processed (for the first time, as usual).
2. In case of error occurred, value refund will be done by attaching it to err

commits.message: properly attach and manage value on replies
force non-reply-able messages keep value on program
extend test with panic case on exit
do not deposit value in case of error replies, but move locked balances
